instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
threads.message: Hello, I have a late 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that will not detect any internal hard drive, It can boot from a usb and then work fine except it will not see the internal hard drive. I have tried 5 different cables and hard drives with no luck. Where should i start?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
threads.message: Yes actually it does spin up

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
threads.message:
ok, then lets start by checking <RESISTOR>R4533</RESISTOR> - 36.

Does <CHIP>U4510</CHIP> get 1.5V on pin 6 ?

Also there are lots of shitty third party HDD flex cables . You tested one of your new ones in a known good laptop ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R4533</RESISTOR> and 36 check out but <CHIP>U4510</CHIP> pin 6 is 0v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
threads.message: <CHIP>U4510</CHIP> without any input power could be a problem. Check if any power on pin 16 of <CHIP>U4510</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
threads.message: Hmm, possibly missing <SIGNAL>1V5_S0</SIGNAL> completely. Is 1V5 present on L7770? Short to GND on this rail? Audio will be missing too if <SIGNAL>1V5_S0</SIGNAL> is not there.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
threads.message: No voltage is present on L7770. I checked and you are right, there is no audio also. I tried to test for a short to ground and did not detect one, To me it matched up with a known good board but i have never tested for a short to ground before so I'm not positive i did it right.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
threads.message: Check voltage on pins 1 and 3 from <CHIP>U7770</CHIP>, with board powered on....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
threads.message: Pin 1 has 3.2v but pin 3 has pretty much zero v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
threads.message: Pin 3 enable comes straight from <SIGNAL>SLP_S3</SIGNAL> through <RESISTOR>R7988</RESISTOR>. <SIGNAL>SLP_S3</SIGNAL> must be present for the board to work so I bet <CHIP>U7770</CHIP> is dead and pulling down the enable signal after <RESISTOR>R7988</RESISTOR>. Replace <CHIP>U7770</CHIP>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wont detect ANY hard drive
threads.message: Fixed, it was <CHIP>U7770</CHIP>. Thanks again guys
